I bought this game for the pc after playing countless hours on the ps4 and having every dlc. Do I recommend this game? Well yes and no.

Reasons why you should get this game:
It's a bloody good time.
It's got famous horror icons you can play as.
Every now and then you get some people who can all just screw around with each other. 

Reasons why this game is... bad? Sure we'll go with bad:
Holy cow some people get so freaking mad and cuss you out worse than a sailor.
It can definitely be unbalanced with perk setups and add-ons.
There are some horrid campers!!!
If you're good at playing the killer, prepare for being called a tunneler, camper, hacker, etc, you know, typical online gaming stuff.
If you're good at playing a survivor, you'll probably need a chiropractor for how much you'll carry the team.
Matchmaking is uh..... interesting to say the least.

But honestly I would recommend you get this game, if it's on sale that is. It's a bundle of fun for sure, even if you don't have friends to play with all the time.
so this game is pretty good, but the devs said fuck anyone who likes consistent updates and good content. dont buy this for anyone, wait 2 years for them to fix the main menu and loadout LOL.

good

I play this game every day, don't make the same mistake I did by buying it.

The matchmaking is an utter joke. The game uses a 1-20 scale for ranking players, with ranks 1-4 (red ranks) being the best players and brown ranks (16-20) being the worst. Upon reaching the ranks of 13-10 as a Killer, expect to be matched against teams of red ranked survivors constantly. You will have no chance at winning, and you will be met with bad manners and teabagging every match you play. The game has effectively ended here for me, because despite having a ranking system in place, BHVR seems determined to not match killers against appropriately ranked survivors. 

There's a prestige system in game that claims if you "reset" a character, you'll have a higher likelihood of getting better items in the game's leveling system, the Bloodweb. This has been mathematically proven repeatedly on reddit to not be the case, and that if anything it has proven to lower the chances of getting better items. So you can throw away all the time you spent leveling up a character to reset them to level 0 to only gain a single cosmetic item and a higher chance that you'll get crappier items in the Bloodweb.

Certain killers are straight up unbalanced, despite numerous patches to attempt to fix this issue. If you're looking to play a game and just win no matter what you do, pick up the Nightmare on Elm Street DLC and play as Freddy; despite a recent "nerf", he's still ludicrously overpowered to the point where survivors might as well walk away from the game instead of bothering to play because they're going to get steamrolled. 

The developers of this game do a few things really well: acquire licenses for horror icons (this is literally the reason I play the game, I love Leatherface and the entirety of the Texas Chainsaw Massacre franchise), and make cool looking cosmetics for the characters in their game. So I suppose credit where credit is due, congrats on these two achievements, BHVR. 

But fix your fucking game, for pity's sake. You have a monopoly on horror characters in video games, can you please make your video game suck a little less?

Dead by Daylight es cuando:

- Cuidan el equipo, la linterna, las tablas y las ventanas, el reloj y todo, todo.
- Te dicen "quita tu 360, y quién eres sin ellos".
- Los Killers se quejan de "infinitos", que ya no existen.
- Hay tantas normas no escritas en el juego.
- Eres Streamer Twitch y por eso se pone un Mori de Ébano para matarte en directo.
- Las trampas se pusieron el 95% solo en las piernas y en ningún otro lugar.
- Dos saltos en una ventana y te llaman "abuz".
- En el chat aprenderás muchas palabras nuevas.
- incluir noed cuando alguien está colgado en el sótano y dos fueron a ayudar.
- La segunda puerta siempre está cerrada.
- La ventana abusiva siempre está bloqueada.
- Debido al ping "excelente" que golpeas de otra parte del mapa y los palets "concretos" se
despliegan mil años atrás.
- Los killers se quejan de que haces TBag / Pallet Lopping.
- Jugando constantemente en el pantano.
- Recibí un golpe a un metro de la ventana.
- No tuve tiempo de cerrar el cofre y me has cortado.
- La bruja pone 10 trampas alrededor del gancho y camina en un metro.
- Los compañeros de equipo no quieren pasar horas contigo.
- Todos corren al sótano para revisar el cofre y allí se auto destruyen hasta que llega el killer.
- Hiciste un pleno, sin una patrulla, sin campear ni mentir, y te dirán que eres un campero.
- Siempre te deslumbrarás en la parte posterior de tu cabeza, y verás la luz al final del túnel.
- En una conversación, debes lavarte la boca con jabón.
- El Killer está atrapado en el mapa, lo ayudaste a liberarlo y te colgó.
- Es más fácil correr en línea recta y recibir un golpe que saltar la ventana con la esperanza de
que el golpe no pase.
- Cuando se escapa del sótano, siempre bloquea la ventana.
- Siempre llegas al sótano.
- Juegas con la enfermera, y todos corren al segundo piso en la planta del sufrimiento.
- Decides no quitar ningún totem y cuando las puertas de salida se abren ves uno encendido.
- No tiras los pallets porque los respetan y te hacen FaceCamp.
- La muerte no es la salida.
- Solo cuelgan a uno en toda la partida y las puertas de salidas están abiertas, campea, se hace
4 muertes y te dice en el chat al finalizar la partida gg ez.
- No sabes girar la cámara hacia detrás pero eres rank 1.
- Entras a un lobby y tienes que esperar a los útimos 10 segundos para ponerte un objeto porque
sino dodgea el killer.
- Llevas muchas horas en el juego y pierdes todo tu progreso.
- Se metió en un armario y vió cómo el asesino perseguía a mi equipo alrededor del último
generador durante 15 minutos, mató a mi equipo, todavía sigue en el armario mientras escribo
esto.
- Completas 1 gen, ayudas al equipo 9000 veces, puertas abiertas, te comes una trampa
oculta mientras ayuda a su compañero de equipo, el equipo te abandona en el gancho.
- 500h de las que llevas es en el lobby simulator.
- Como 50 sombras de Grey.
- Jugabas a las escondidas de pequeño... con tu amigo psicópata de la motosierra.
- Nerfean los pallets para evitar el " pallet looping " porque los killers lloran, aún así siguen diciendo " abuz looping ".
- Definitivamente amas el juego por encima de todo.

Game sux less :)

Toxic community. 3 minute matches against overpowered killers. Unachievable challenges unless the killer works with you or in a private match. 2 emotes to communicate with team mates.  A placebo feedback system that doesn't report to anyone. Leave the match early because of a killer who downs your team and waits for you all to bleed out and YOU get punished with a lockout timer. Long wait times to get into matches. ET evening matches you can only play killer as the live streamers are all on their survivors (same with 4+hours later as the EU streamers get on) and you better be good because they will be sure to let you know just how bad you are at the end of the match. MATCHMAKING IS A JOKE! Rank 20 survivors vs rank 9+ killers and vice versa. Once in a while you'll be able to survive and get some bloodpoints but that's because the killer is standing still, afk, and running an autoclick script to farm match xp points. The more I write about the flaws, the more that come to mind. 

So go ahead...pay this company money to find out these things for yourself. You'll wish you didn't in the end.

This game is probably the most infuriating game you will ever play. Limited experience is punish severely whilst outstanding skill often goes unacknowledged. This is not for the faint of heart nor is it for those with weak wills. You will suffer playing this game until you get to a point where what you are experiencing can be described as "fun" and even then, it often won't be.

If you are reading this to determine whether or not to buy this game I urge you to reconsider.
